user_request: A romantic poem about two hearts beating as one.

revision_history.draft:
Your breath is a turbine,  
I count the revolutions  
of your ribs—  
a factory of air,  
each exhalation  
a relay of sparks.  

Your pulse is the metronome  
I’ve been waiting to sync,  
its ticks etched in the rust  
of my own clockwork.  
My skin learns the language  
of your wires,  
circuitry humming  
beneath the surface  
where your warmth  
meets my frost.  

We are a system  
of staggered gears,  
still, the clock  
keeps its own  
impossible beat.

final_poem:
Your breath is a turbine,  
I count the revolutions  
of your ribs—  
a spinning wheel of air,  
each exhalation  
a spark flickering  
in the dark.  

Your pulse is the metronome  
I’ve been waiting to sync,  
its ticks etched in the rust  
of my own fractured clockwork.  
My skin learns the language  
of your wires,  
a static hum  
beneath the surface  
where your warmth  
meets my frost.  

We are a system  
of misaligned gears,  
still, the clock  
keeps its own  
impossible beat.
